thread.title: Four Critical After SUV Plows Into High School Band At Mardi Gras Parade
thread.title_full: Four Critical After SUV Plows Into High School Band At Mardi Gras Parade

author: Randy DeSoto
title: Four Critical After SUV Plows Into High School Band At Mardi Gras Parade
text:
Four Critical After SUV Plows Into High School Band At Mardi Gras Parade "We ask for thoughts and prayers." by Randy DeSoto February 28, 2017 at 12:11pm Share on Facebook Share Tweet Email Email Print Advertisement - story continues below 
An SUV plowed into members of a high school band marching in the Gulf Shores, Ala., Mardi Gras parade on Tuesday, injuring 12. 
Gulf Shores spokesman Grant Brown told reporters that four of the students from the Gulf Shores High School band involved in the incident are in critical condition. 
“A teenage band had just started to march down the parade route when they were struck from behind. The vehicle was a part of the parade,” Brown stated. Advertisement - story continues below Black Senate Staffer Hired By Sessions Confronts CNN Contributor’s Racist Claims 
An eyewitness told a local Fox affiliate that the vehicle struck the students from behind and “mowed them over.” 
While the Department of Homeland Security is monitoring the situation, authorities do not believe the crash was intentional. 
“Every indication is that it was a tragic accident by an elderly man” driving a late model SUV, said Police Chief Ed Delmore. Advertisement - story continues below 
Brown said the 73-year-old driver is believed to be from nearby Fairhope, Ala. It is believed that the incident was a tragic accident. 3 of the victims are in critical condition. @LOCAL15NEWS pic.twitter.com/7rfh8apbLu 
— Cory Pippin (@CoryPippinTV) February 28, 2017 
City officials cancelled the parade, following the incident. Breaking: Car plows into crowd at Mardi Gras parade in Gulf Shores, Ala.; injuries reported. https://t.co/jRzZjCLehc pic.twitter.com/LHRLU329Mc 
— Fox News (@FoxNews) February 28, 2017 Advertisement - story continues below
